pullRequest.body:
... is the product of the characteristic polynomials.


---

nodes.body: :v: jcommelin can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7956859484/job/21718410244)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7956859484/job/21718409966)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7956859484/job/21718409548)

Thanks!

bors d+
I've left a few minor comments.

Thanks!

bors d+

Is it the case that this can't live next to `[Matrix.charpoly_natDegree_eq_dim](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/LinearAlgebra/Matrix/Charpoly/Coeff.html#Matrix.charpoly_natDegree_eq_dim)` because of imports? If so, please add references to each declaration letting the user know about the exists of the other. If not, please move this next to `Matrix.charpoly_natDegree_eq_dim`.

Potentially, consider adding `eq_finrank_dim` or something for parallelism, but actually I think I prefer your naming.
I think there is basically no other cross-refs between `Matrix.charpoly` stuff and `LinearMap.charpoly` stuff. If we want that, I suggest that we do it in a follow-up docs PR.
I have no strong feelings here but I'd probably side with @j-loreaux
Fair enough. No need to do it in this PR.
This is a lot of variables to have for just one declaration. Maybe just add them to that declaration instead?
Ok, done. I did leave the types `M_1` and `M_2` in place, so that they appear at the beginning of the list of parameters, instead of after the `[CommRing R] [Nontrivial R]`, which I prefer.

This isn't necessary, right? We have [instDecidableEqSum](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Init/Core.html#instDecidableEqSum)
```suggestion
lemma LinearMap.toMatrix_prodMap [DecidableEq n] [DecidableEq m]
```
I think @urkud argued that we shouldn't rely on that instance for statements (but using it in proofs is fine). Yury, can you confirm?

I think @jcommelin is right here: we should be unopinionated about data in lemmas.

For example if we have a definition consuming terms of type `Matrix ι ι R` whose statement needs `[DecidableEq ι]` and we want to combine this lemma with it in the case `ι = n ⊕ m` then we need this extra flexibility.

I think we can be consistent about letting Lean manage universes without any other changes.
```suggestion
variable {R M M₁ M₂ : Type*} [CommRing R] [Nontrivial R]
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(LinearAlgebra/Charpoly): the characteristic polynomial of a direct sum
